intro: Thymus elisabethae, commonly known as Elizabeth's thyme, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It features tiny, aromatic leaves that are typically gray-green in color, covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers in clusters during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is often cultivated in gardens and herbal collections.
